sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects.title: #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects Integer-Indexed Exotic Objects
sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects.html:
#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects Integer-Indexed Exotic Objects

An Integer-Indexed exotic object is an exotic object that performs special handling of integer index property keys.

Integer-Indexed exotic objects have the same internal slots as ordinary objects and additionally [[ViewedArrayBuffer]], [[ArrayLength]], [[ByteOffset]], [[ContentType]], and [[TypedArrayName]] internal slots.

An object is an Integer-Indexed exotic object if its [[GetOwnProperty]], [[HasProperty]], [[DefineOwnProperty]], [[Get]], [[Set]], and [[OwnPropertyKeys]] internal methods use the definitions in this section, and its other essential internal methods use the definitions found in #sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots. These methods are installed by IntegerIndexedObjectCreate.

sec-%typedarray%.prototype.slice.title: #sec-%typedarray%.prototype.slice %TypedArray%.prototype.slice ( start, end )
sec-%typedarray%.prototype.slice.html:
#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.slice %TypedArray%.prototype.slice ( start, end )

The interpretation and use of the arguments of %TypedArray%.prototype.slice are the same as for Array.prototype.slice as defined in #sec-array.prototype.slice. The following steps are taken:

  1. Let O be the this value.
  2. Perform ? ValidateTypedArray(O).
  3. Let len be O.[[ArrayLength]].
  4. Let relativeStart be ? ToIntegerOrInfinity(start).
  5. If relativeStart is -∞, let k be 0.
  6. Else if relativeStart < 0, let k be max(len + relativeStart, 0).
  7. Else, let k be min(relativeStart, len).
  8. If end is undefined, let relativeEnd be len; else let relativeEnd be ? ToIntegerOrInfinity(end).
  9. If relativeEnd is -∞, let final be 0.
  10. Else if relativeEnd < 0, let final be max(len + relativeEnd, 0).
  11. Else, let final be min(relativeEnd, len).
  12. Let count be max(final - k, 0).
  13. Let A be ? TypedArraySpeciesCreate(O, « 𝔽(count) »).
  14. Let srcName be the String value of O.[[TypedArrayName]].
  15. Let srcType be the Element Type value in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for srcName.
  16. Let targetName be the String value of A.[[TypedArrayName]].
  17. Let targetType be the Element Type value in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for targetName.
  18. If srcType is different from targetType, then
    1. Let n be 0.
    2. Repeat, while k < final,
      1. Let Pk be ! ToString(𝔽(k)).
      2. Let kValue be ? Get(O, Pk).
      3. Perform ! Set(A, ! ToString(𝔽(n)), kValue, true).
      4. Set k to k + 1.
      5. Set n to n + 1.
  19. Else if count > 0, then
    1. Let srcBuffer be O.[[ViewedArrayBuffer]].
    2. If IsDetachedBuffer(srcBuffer) is true, throw a TypeError exception.
    3. Let targetBuffer be A.[[ViewedArrayBuffer]].
    4. Let elementSize be the Element Size value specified in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for Element Type srcType.
    5. NOTE: If srcType and targetType are the same, the transfer must be performed in a manner that preserves the bit-level encoding of the source data.
    6. Let srcByteOffet be O.[[ByteOffset]].
    7. Let targetByteIndex be A.[[ByteOffset]].
    8. Let srcByteIndex be (k × elementSize) + srcByteOffet.
    9. Let limit be targetByteIndex + count × elementSize.
    10. Repeat, while targetByteIndex < limit,
      1. Let value be GetValueFromBuffer(srcBuffer, srcByteIndex, Uint8, true, Unordered).
      2. Perform SetValueInBuffer(targetBuffer, targetByteIndex, Uint8, value, true, Unordered).
      3. Set srcByteIndex to srcByteIndex + 1.
      4. Set targetByteIndex to targetByteIndex + 1.
  20. Return A.

This function is not generic. The this value must be an object with a [[TypedArrayName]] internal slot.

sec-%typedarray%.prototype.map.title: #sec-%typedarray%.prototype.map %TypedArray%.prototype.map ( callbackfn [ , thisArg ] )
sec-%typedarray%.prototype.map.html:
#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.map %TypedArray%.prototype.map ( callbackfn [ , thisArg ] )

The interpretation and use of the arguments of %TypedArray%.prototype.map are the same as for Array.prototype.map as defined in #sec-array.prototype.map.

When the map method is called with one or two arguments, the following steps are taken:

  1. Let O be the this value.
  2. Perform ? ValidateTypedArray(O).
  3. Let len be O.[[ArrayLength]].
  4. If IsCallable(callbackfn) is false, throw a TypeError exception.
  5. Let A be ? TypedArraySpeciesCreate(O, « 𝔽(len) »).
  6. Let k be 0.
  7. Repeat, while k < len,
    1. Let Pk be ! ToString(𝔽(k)).
    2. Let kValue be ? Get(O, Pk).
    3. Let mappedValue be ? Call(callbackfn, thisArg, « kValue, 𝔽(k), O »).
    4. Perform ? Set(A, Pk, mappedValue, true).
    5. Set k to k + 1.
  8. Return A.

This function is not generic. The this value must be an object with a [[TypedArrayName]] internal slot.

sec-integerindexedelementget.title: #sec-integerindexedelementget IntegerIndexedElementGet ( O, index )
sec-integerindexedelementget.html:
#sec-integerindexedelementget IntegerIndexedElementGet ( O, index )

The abstract operation IntegerIndexedElementGet takes arguments O and index (a Number). It performs the following steps when called:

  1. Assert: O is an Integer-Indexed exotic object.
  2. Let buffer be O.[[ViewedArrayBuffer]].
  3. If IsDetachedBuffer(buffer) is true, throw a TypeError exception.
  4. If ! IsValidIntegerIndex(O, index) is false, return undefined.
  5. Let offset be O.[[ByteOffset]].
  6. Let arrayTypeName be the String value of O.[[TypedArrayName]].
  7. Let elementSize be the Element Size value specified in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for arrayTypeName.
  8. Let indexedPosition be (ℝ(index) × elementSize) + offset.
  9. Let elementType be the Element Type value in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for arrayTypeName.
  10. Return GetValueFromBuffer(buffer, indexedPosition, elementType, true, Unordered).

sec-%typedarray%.prototype.filter.title: #sec-%typedarray%.prototype.filter %TypedArray%.prototype.filter ( callbackfn [ , thisArg ] )
sec-%typedarray%.prototype.filter.html:
#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.filter %TypedArray%.prototype.filter ( callbackfn [ , thisArg ] )

The interpretation and use of the arguments of %TypedArray%.prototype.filter are the same as for Array.prototype.filter as defined in #sec-array.prototype.filter.

When the filter method is called with one or two arguments, the following steps are taken:

  1. Let O be the this value.
  2. Perform ? ValidateTypedArray(O).
  3. Let len be O.[[ArrayLength]].
  4. If IsCallable(callbackfn) is false, throw a TypeError exception.
  5. Let kept be a new empty List.
  6. Let k be 0.
  7. Let captured be 0.
  8. Repeat, while k < len,
    1. Let Pk be ! ToString(𝔽(k)).
    2. Let kValue be ? Get(O, Pk).
    3. Let selected be ! ToBoolean(? Call(callbackfn, thisArg, « kValue, 𝔽(k), O »)).
    4. If selected is true, then
      1. Append kValue to the end of kept.
      2. Set captured to captured + 1.
    5. Set k to k + 1.
  9. Let A be ? TypedArraySpeciesCreate(O, « 𝔽(captured) »).
  10. Let n be 0.
  11. For each element e of kept, do
    1. Perform ! Set(A, ! ToString(𝔽(n)), e, true).
    2. Set n to n + 1.
  12. Return A.

This function is not generic. The this value must be an object with a [[TypedArrayName]] internal slot.

sec-integerindexedelementset.title: #sec-integerindexedelementset IntegerIndexedElementSet ( O, index, value )
sec-integerindexedelementset.html:
#sec-integerindexedelementset IntegerIndexedElementSet ( O, index, value )

The abstract operation IntegerIndexedElementSet takes arguments O, index (a Number), and value. It performs the following steps when called:

  1. Assert: O is an Integer-Indexed exotic object.
  2. If O.[[ContentType]] is BigInt, let numValue be ? ToBigInt(value).
  3. Otherwise, let numValue be ? ToNumber(value).
  4. Let buffer be O.[[ViewedArrayBuffer]].
  5. If IsDetachedBuffer(buffer) is true, throw a TypeError exception.
  6. If ! IsValidIntegerIndex(O, index) is false, return false.
  7. Let offset be O.[[ByteOffset]].
  8. Let arrayTypeName be the String value of O.[[TypedArrayName]].
  9. Let elementSize be the Element Size value specified in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for arrayTypeName.
  10. Let indexedPosition be (ℝ(index) × elementSize) + offset.
  11. Let elementType be the Element Type value in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for arrayTypeName.
  12. Perform SetValueInBuffer(buffer, indexedPosition, elementType, numValue, true, Unordered).
  13. Return true.

sec-get-arraybuffer.prototype.bytelength.title: #sec-get-arraybuffer.prototype.bytelength get ArrayBuffer.prototype.byteLength
sec-get-arraybuffer.prototype.bytelength.html:
#sec-get-arraybuffer.prototype.bytelength get ArrayBuffer.prototype.byteLength

ArrayBuffer.prototype.byteLength is an accessor property whose set accessor function is undefined. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

  1. Let O be the this value.
  2. Perform ? RequireInternalSlot(O, [[ArrayBufferData]]).
  3. If IsSharedArrayBuffer(O) is true, throw a TypeError exception.
  4. If IsDetachedBuffer(O) is true, throw a TypeError exception.
  5. Let length be O.[[ArrayBufferByteLength]].
  6. Return 𝔽(length).

sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-get-p.title: #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-get-p-receiver [[Get]] ( P, Receiver )
sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-get-p.html:
#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-get-p-receiver [[Get]] ( P, Receiver )

When the [[Get]] internal method of an Integer-Indexed exotic object O is called with property key P and ECMAScript language value Receiver, the following steps are taken:

  1. Assert: IsPropertyKey(P) is true.
  2. If Type(P) is String, then
    1. Let numericIndex be ! CanonicalNumericIndexString(P).
    2. If numericIndex is not undefined, then
      1. Return ? IntegerIndexedElementGet(O, numericIndex).
  3. Return ? OrdinaryGet(O, P, Receiver).

sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-haspr.title: #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-hasproperty-p [[HasProperty]] ( P )
sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-haspr.html:
#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-hasproperty-p [[HasProperty]] ( P )

When the [[HasProperty]] internal method of an Integer-Indexed exotic object O is called with property key P, the following steps are taken:

  1. Assert: IsPropertyKey(P) is true.
  2. Assert: O is an Integer-Indexed exotic object.
  3. If Type(P) is String, then
    1. Let numericIndex be ! CanonicalNumericIndexString(P).
    2. If numericIndex is not undefined, then
      1. Let buffer be O.[[ViewedArrayBuffer]].
      2. If IsDetachedBuffer(buffer) is true, throw a TypeError exception.
      3. If ! IsValidIntegerIndex(O, numericIndex) is false, return false.
      4. Return true.
  4. Return ? OrdinaryHasProperty(O, P).

sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-getow.title: #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-getownproperty-p [[GetOwnProperty]] ( P )
sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-getow.html:
#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-getownproperty-p [[GetOwnProperty]] ( P )

When the [[GetOwnProperty]] internal method of an Integer-Indexed exotic object O is called with property key P, the following steps are taken:

  1. Assert: IsPropertyKey(P) is true.
  2. Assert: O is an Integer-Indexed exotic object.
  3. If Type(P) is String, then
    1. Let numericIndex be ! CanonicalNumericIndexString(P).
    2. If numericIndex is not undefined, then
      1. Let value be ? IntegerIndexedElementGet(O, numericIndex).
      2. If value is undefined, return undefined.
      3. Return the PropertyDescriptor { [[Value]]: value, [[Writable]]: true, [[Enumerable]]: true, [[Configurable]]: false }.
  4. Return OrdinaryGetOwnProperty(O, P).

sec-integerindexedobjectcreate.title: #sec-integerindexedobjectcreate IntegerIndexedObjectCreate ( prototype )
sec-integerindexedobjectcreate.html:
#sec-integerindexedobjectcreate IntegerIndexedObjectCreate ( prototype )

The abstract operation IntegerIndexedObjectCreate takes argument prototype. It is used to specify the creation of new Integer-Indexed exotic objects. It performs the following steps when called:

  1. Let internalSlotsList be « [[Prototype]], [[Extensible]], [[ViewedArrayBuffer]], [[TypedArrayName]], [[ContentType]], [[ByteLength]], [[ByteOffset]], [[ArrayLength]] ».
  2. Let A be ! MakeBasicObject(internalSlotsList).
  3. Set A.[[GetOwnProperty]] as specified in #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-getownproperty-p.
  4. Set A.[[HasProperty]] as specified in #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-hasproperty-p.
  5. Set A.[[DefineOwnProperty]] as specified in #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc.
  6. Set A.[[Get]] as specified in #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-get-p-receiver.
  7. Set A.[[Set]] as specified in #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-set-p-v-receiver.
  8. Set A.[[OwnPropertyKeys]] as specified in #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-ownpropertykeys.
  9. Set A.[[Prototype]] to prototype.
  10. Return A.

sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-defin.title: #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc [[DefineOwnProperty]] ( P, Desc )
sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-defin.html:
#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc [[DefineOwnProperty]] ( P, Desc )

When the [[DefineOwnProperty]] internal method of an Integer-Indexed exotic object O is called with property key P, and Property Descriptor Desc, the following steps are taken:

  1. Assert: IsPropertyKey(P) is true.
  2. Assert: O is an Integer-Indexed exotic object.
  3. If Type(P) is String, then
    1. Let numericIndex be ! CanonicalNumericIndexString(P).
    2. If numericIndex is not undefined, then
      1. If ! IsValidIntegerIndex(O, numericIndex) is false, return false.
      2. If IsAccessorDescriptor(Desc) is true, return false.
      3. If Desc has a [[Configurable]] field and if Desc.[[Configurable]] is true, return false.
      4. If Desc has an [[Enumerable]] field and if Desc.[[Enumerable]] is false, return false.
      5. If Desc has a [[Writable]] field and if Desc.[[Writable]] is false, return false.
      6. If Desc has a [[Value]] field, then
        1. Let value be Desc.[[Value]].
        2. Return ? IntegerIndexedElementSet(O, numericIndex, value).
      7. Return true.
  4. Return ! OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty(O, P, Desc).

sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects.title: #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects Integer-Indexed Exotic Objects
sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects.html:
#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects Integer-Indexed Exotic Objects

An Integer-Indexed exotic object is an exotic object that performs special handling of integer index property keys.

Integer-Indexed exotic objects have the same internal slots as ordinary objects and additionally [[ViewedArrayBuffer]], [[ArrayLength]], [[ByteOffset]], [[ContentType]], and [[TypedArrayName]] internal slots.

An object is an Integer-Indexed exotic object if its [[GetOwnProperty]], [[HasProperty]], [[DefineOwnProperty]], [[Get]], [[Set]], [[Delete]], and [[OwnPropertyKeys]] internal methods use the definitions in this section, and its other essential internal methods use the definitions found in #sec-ordinary-object-internal-methods-and-internal-slots. These methods are installed by IntegerIndexedObjectCreate.

sec-%typedarray%.prototype.slice.title: #sec-%typedarray%.prototype.slice %TypedArray%.prototype.slice ( start, end )
sec-%typedarray%.prototype.slice.html:
#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.slice %TypedArray%.prototype.slice ( start, end )

The interpretation and use of the arguments of %TypedArray%.prototype.slice are the same as for Array.prototype.slice as defined in #sec-array.prototype.slice. The following steps are taken:

  1. Let O be the this value.
  2. Perform ? ValidateTypedArray(O).
  3. Let len be O.[[ArrayLength]].
  4. Let relativeStart be ? ToIntegerOrInfinity(start).
  5. If relativeStart is -∞, let k be 0.
  6. Else if relativeStart < 0, let k be max(len + relativeStart, 0).
  7. Else, let k be min(relativeStart, len).
  8. If end is undefined, let relativeEnd be len; else let relativeEnd be ? ToIntegerOrInfinity(end).
  9. If relativeEnd is -∞, let final be 0.
  10. Else if relativeEnd < 0, let final be max(len + relativeEnd, 0).
  11. Else, let final be min(relativeEnd, len).
  12. Let count be max(final - k, 0).
  13. Let A be ? TypedArraySpeciesCreate(O, « 𝔽(count) »).
  14. If count > 0, then
    1. If IsDetachedBuffer(O.[[ViewedArrayBuffer]]) is true, throw a TypeError exception.
    2. Let srcName be the String value of O.[[TypedArrayName]].
    3. Let srcType be the Element Type value in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for srcName.
    4. Let targetName be the String value of A.[[TypedArrayName]].
    5. Let targetType be the Element Type value in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for targetName.
    6. If srcType is different from targetType, then
      1. Let n be 0.
      2. Repeat, while k < final,
        1. Let Pk be ! ToString(𝔽(k)).
        2. Let kValue be ! Get(O, Pk).
        3. Perform ! Set(A, ! ToString(𝔽(n)), kValue, true).
        4. Set k to k + 1.
        5. Set n to n + 1.
    7. Else,
      1. Let srcBuffer be O.[[ViewedArrayBuffer]].
      2. Let targetBuffer be A.[[ViewedArrayBuffer]].
      3. Let elementSize be the Element Size value specified in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for Element Type srcType.
      4. NOTE: If srcType and targetType are the same, the transfer must be performed in a manner that preserves the bit-level encoding of the source data.
      5. Let srcByteOffset be O.[[ByteOffset]].
      6. Let targetByteIndex be A.[[ByteOffset]].
      7. Let srcByteIndex be (k × elementSize) + srcByteOffset.
      8. Let limit be targetByteIndex + count × elementSize.
      9. Repeat, while targetByteIndex < limit,
        1. Let value be GetValueFromBuffer(srcBuffer, srcByteIndex, Uint8, true, Unordered).
        2. Perform SetValueInBuffer(targetBuffer, targetByteIndex, Uint8, value, true, Unordered).
        3. Set srcByteIndex to srcByteIndex + 1.
        4. Set targetByteIndex to targetByteIndex + 1.
  15. Return A.

This function is not generic. The this value must be an object with a [[TypedArrayName]] internal slot.

sec-%typedarray%.prototype.map.title: #sec-%typedarray%.prototype.map %TypedArray%.prototype.map ( callbackfn [ , thisArg ] )
sec-%typedarray%.prototype.map.html:
#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.map %TypedArray%.prototype.map ( callbackfn [ , thisArg ] )

The interpretation and use of the arguments of %TypedArray%.prototype.map are the same as for Array.prototype.map as defined in #sec-array.prototype.map.

When the map method is called with one or two arguments, the following steps are taken:

  1. Let O be the this value.
  2. Perform ? ValidateTypedArray(O).
  3. Let len be O.[[ArrayLength]].
  4. If IsCallable(callbackfn) is false, throw a TypeError exception.
  5. Let A be ? TypedArraySpeciesCreate(O, « 𝔽(len) »).
  6. Let k be 0.
  7. Repeat, while k < len,
    1. Let Pk be ! ToString(𝔽(k)).
    2. Let kValue be ! Get(O, Pk).
    3. Let mappedValue be ? Call(callbackfn, thisArg, « kValue, 𝔽(k), O »).
    4. Perform ? Set(A, Pk, mappedValue, true).
    5. Set k to k + 1.
  8. Return A.

This function is not generic. The this value must be an object with a [[TypedArrayName]] internal slot.

sec-integerindexedelementget.title: #sec-integerindexedelementget IntegerIndexedElementGet ( O, index )
sec-integerindexedelementget.html:
#sec-integerindexedelementget IntegerIndexedElementGet ( O, index )

The abstract operation IntegerIndexedElementGet takes arguments O and index (a Number). It performs the following steps when called:

  1. Assert: O is an Integer-Indexed exotic object.
  2. Let buffer be O.[[ViewedArrayBuffer]].
  3. If IsDetachedBuffer(buffer) is true, return undefined.
  4. If ! IsValidIntegerIndex(O, index) is false, return undefined.
  5. Let offset be O.[[ByteOffset]].
  6. Let arrayTypeName be the String value of O.[[TypedArrayName]].
  7. Let elementSize be the Element Size value specified in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for arrayTypeName.
  8. Let indexedPosition be (ℝ(index) × elementSize) + offset.
  9. Let elementType be the Element Type value in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for arrayTypeName.
  10. Return GetValueFromBuffer(buffer, indexedPosition, elementType, true, Unordered).

sec-%typedarray%.prototype.filter.title: #sec-%typedarray%.prototype.filter %TypedArray%.prototype.filter ( callbackfn [ , thisArg ] )
sec-%typedarray%.prototype.filter.html:
#sec-%typedarray%.prototype.filter %TypedArray%.prototype.filter ( callbackfn [ , thisArg ] )

The interpretation and use of the arguments of %TypedArray%.prototype.filter are the same as for Array.prototype.filter as defined in #sec-array.prototype.filter.

When the filter method is called with one or two arguments, the following steps are taken:

  1. Let O be the this value.
  2. Perform ? ValidateTypedArray(O).
  3. Let len be O.[[ArrayLength]].
  4. If IsCallable(callbackfn) is false, throw a TypeError exception.
  5. Let kept be a new empty List.
  6. Let k be 0.
  7. Let captured be 0.
  8. Repeat, while k < len,
    1. Let Pk be ! ToString(𝔽(k)).
    2. Let kValue be ! Get(O, Pk).
    3. Let selected be ! ToBoolean(? Call(callbackfn, thisArg, « kValue, 𝔽(k), O »)).
    4. If selected is true, then
      1. Append kValue to the end of kept.
      2. Set captured to captured + 1.
    5. Set k to k + 1.
  9. Let A be ? TypedArraySpeciesCreate(O, « 𝔽(captured) »).
  10. Let n be 0.
  11. For each element e of kept, do
    1. Perform ! Set(A, ! ToString(𝔽(n)), e, true).
    2. Set n to n + 1.
  12. Return A.

This function is not generic. The this value must be an object with a [[TypedArrayName]] internal slot.

sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-delet.title: #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-delete-p [[Delete]] ( P )
sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-delet.html:
#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-delete-p [[Delete]] ( P )

When the [[Delete]] internal method of an Integer-Indexed exotic object O is called with property key P, the following steps are taken:

  1. Assert: IsPropertyKey(P) is true.
  2. Assert: O is an Integer-Indexed exotic object.
  3. If Type(P) is String, then
    1. Let numericIndex be ! CanonicalNumericIndexString(P).
    2. If numericIndex is not undefined, then
      1. If IsDetachedBuffer(O.[[ViewedArrayBuffer]]) is true, return true.
      2. If ! IsValidIntegerIndex(O, numericIndex) is false, return true.
      3. Return false.
  4. Return ? OrdinaryDelete(O, P).

sec-integerindexedelementset.title: #sec-integerindexedelementset IntegerIndexedElementSet ( O, index, value )
sec-integerindexedelementset.html:
#sec-integerindexedelementset IntegerIndexedElementSet ( O, index, value )

The abstract operation IntegerIndexedElementSet takes arguments O, index (a Number), and value. It performs the following steps when called:

  1. Assert: O is an Integer-Indexed exotic object.
  2. If O.[[ContentType]] is BigInt, let numValue be ? ToBigInt(value).
  3. Otherwise, let numValue be ? ToNumber(value).
  4. Let buffer be O.[[ViewedArrayBuffer]].
  5. If IsDetachedBuffer(buffer) is true, return false.
  6. If ! IsValidIntegerIndex(O, index) is false, return false.
  7. Let offset be O.[[ByteOffset]].
  8. Let arrayTypeName be the String value of O.[[TypedArrayName]].
  9. Let elementSize be the Element Size value specified in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for arrayTypeName.
  10. Let indexedPosition be (ℝ(index) × elementSize) + offset.
  11. Let elementType be the Element Type value in #table-the-typedarray-constructors for arrayTypeName.
  12. Perform SetValueInBuffer(buffer, indexedPosition, elementType, numValue, true, Unordered).
  13. Return true.

sec-get-arraybuffer.prototype.bytelength.title: #sec-get-arraybuffer.prototype.bytelength get ArrayBuffer.prototype.byteLength
sec-get-arraybuffer.prototype.bytelength.html:
#sec-get-arraybuffer.prototype.bytelength get ArrayBuffer.prototype.byteLength

ArrayBuffer.prototype.byteLength is an accessor property whose set accessor function is undefined. Its get accessor function performs the following steps:

  1. Let O be the this value.
  2. Perform ? RequireInternalSlot(O, [[ArrayBufferData]]).
  3. If IsSharedArrayBuffer(O) is true, throw a TypeError exception.
  4. If IsDetachedBuffer(O) is true, return +0𝔽.
  5. Let length be O.[[ArrayBufferByteLength]].
  6. Return 𝔽(length).

sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-get-p.title: #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-get-p-receiver [[Get]] ( P, Receiver )
sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-get-p.html:
#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-get-p-receiver [[Get]] ( P, Receiver )

When the [[Get]] internal method of an Integer-Indexed exotic object O is called with property key P and ECMAScript language value Receiver, the following steps are taken:

  1. Assert: IsPropertyKey(P) is true.
  2. If Type(P) is String, then
    1. Let numericIndex be ! CanonicalNumericIndexString(P).
    2. If numericIndex is not undefined, then
      1. Return ! IntegerIndexedElementGet(O, numericIndex).
  3. Return ? OrdinaryGet(O, P, Receiver).

sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-haspr.title: #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-hasproperty-p [[HasProperty]] ( P )
sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-haspr.html:
#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-hasproperty-p [[HasProperty]] ( P )

When the [[HasProperty]] internal method of an Integer-Indexed exotic object O is called with property key P, the following steps are taken:

  1. Assert: IsPropertyKey(P) is true.
  2. Assert: O is an Integer-Indexed exotic object.
  3. If Type(P) is String, then
    1. Let numericIndex be ! CanonicalNumericIndexString(P).
    2. If numericIndex is not undefined, then
      1. Let buffer be O.[[ViewedArrayBuffer]].
      2. If IsDetachedBuffer(buffer) is true, return false.
      3. If ! IsValidIntegerIndex(O, numericIndex) is false, return false.
      4. Return true.
  4. Return ? OrdinaryHasProperty(O, P).

sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-getow.title: #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-getownproperty-p [[GetOwnProperty]] ( P )
sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-getow.html:
#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-getownproperty-p [[GetOwnProperty]] ( P )

When the [[GetOwnProperty]] internal method of an Integer-Indexed exotic object O is called with property key P, the following steps are taken:

  1. Assert: IsPropertyKey(P) is true.
  2. Assert: O is an Integer-Indexed exotic object.
  3. If Type(P) is String, then
    1. Let numericIndex be ! CanonicalNumericIndexString(P).
    2. If numericIndex is not undefined, then
      1. Let value be ! IntegerIndexedElementGet(O, numericIndex).
      2. If value is undefined, return undefined.
      3. Return the PropertyDescriptor { [[Value]]: value, [[Writable]]: true, [[Enumerable]]: true, [[Configurable]]: true }.
  4. Return OrdinaryGetOwnProperty(O, P).

sec-integerindexedobjectcreate.title: #sec-integerindexedobjectcreate IntegerIndexedObjectCreate ( prototype )
sec-integerindexedobjectcreate.html:
#sec-integerindexedobjectcreate IntegerIndexedObjectCreate ( prototype )

The abstract operation IntegerIndexedObjectCreate takes argument prototype. It is used to specify the creation of new Integer-Indexed exotic objects. It performs the following steps when called:

  1. Let internalSlotsList be « [[Prototype]], [[Extensible]], [[ViewedArrayBuffer]], [[TypedArrayName]], [[ContentType]], [[ByteLength]], [[ByteOffset]], [[ArrayLength]] ».
  2. Let A be ! MakeBasicObject(internalSlotsList).
  3. Set A.[[GetOwnProperty]] as specified in #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-getownproperty-p.
  4. Set A.[[HasProperty]] as specified in #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-hasproperty-p.
  5. Set A.[[DefineOwnProperty]] as specified in #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc.
  6. Set A.[[Get]] as specified in #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-get-p-receiver.
  7. Set A.[[Set]] as specified in #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-set-p-v-receiver.
  8. Set A.[[Delete]] as specified in #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-delete-p.
  9. Set A.[[OwnPropertyKeys]] as specified in #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-ownpropertykeys.
  10. Set A.[[Prototype]] to prototype.
  11. Return A.

sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-defin.title: #sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc [[DefineOwnProperty]] ( P, Desc )
sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-defin.html:
#sec-integer-indexed-exotic-objects-defineownproperty-p-desc [[DefineOwnProperty]] ( P, Desc )

When the [[DefineOwnProperty]] internal method of an Integer-Indexed exotic object O is called with property key P, and Property Descriptor Desc, the following steps are taken:

  1. Assert: IsPropertyKey(P) is true.
  2. Assert: O is an Integer-Indexed exotic object.
  3. If Type(P) is String, then
    1. Let numericIndex be ! CanonicalNumericIndexString(P).
    2. If numericIndex is not undefined, then
      1. If ! IsValidIntegerIndex(O, numericIndex) is false, return false.
      2. If IsAccessorDescriptor(Desc) is true, return false.
      3. If Desc has a [[Configurable]] field and if Desc.[[Configurable]] is false, return false.
      4. If Desc has an [[Enumerable]] field and if Desc.[[Enumerable]] is false, return false.
      5. If Desc has a [[Writable]] field and if Desc.[[Writable]] is false, return false.
      6. If Desc has a [[Value]] field, then
        1. Let value be Desc.[[Value]].
        2. Return ? IntegerIndexedElementSet(O, numericIndex, value).
      7. Return true.
  4. Return ! OrdinaryDefineOwnProperty(O, P, Desc).
